TunableList.name: object_reference
TunableList.description: List of objects the spawner can create. When the random check picks this value from the weight calculation it will give all the items tuned on this list.

TunableVariant.description: Specify the means by which will the spawner will create the object.

TunableTuple.name: object_definition
TunableTuple.description: Factory that provides a way to create an object from an object definition.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The definition of the object to be created.

TunableTuple.name: recipe
TunableTuple.description: Factory that provides a way to create an object from a recipe.

Tunable.name: recipe
Tunable.description: Recipe to produce an object with.

TunableList.name: weighted_quality
TunableList.description: A list of weighted quality in which the object will be created. If empty, it will apply a default quality.

TunableTuple.description: A possible level of quality for this item that will be generated. This will be randomly chosen based off weight against other items in the list.

TdescFragTag.name: owner_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Conditional tests to be passed on the component's owner to determine if spawning can occur.

Tunable.name: spawn_chance
Tunable.description: The chance that the spawned object will actually be created. This is in case we want spawned objects to not be created in a predictable behavior and the change of 'nothing happening' be available.

TunableVariant.name: spawn_times
TunableVariant.description: Schedule of when the spawners should trigger. If this time is tuned spawners will trigger according to this schedule instead of the spawner commodities. This should be used for spawners that are on the open neighborhood so that those spawners are time based instead of commodity based.

Instance.TunableVariant: <TunableTuple name="Set_custom_spawn_times" class="TunableWeeklySchedule" display="Set Custom Spawn Times" description="A class representing a tuned weekly schedule. This class can be used to start alarms that will be called based on the tuning. min_alarm_time_span: if set, if timespan until next alarm has a timespan < min_alarm_time_span, timespan till alarm will be set to min_alarm_time_span extra_data: extra data to pass back each time the alarm is called start_callback will take in parameters: scheduler, Tuple of type AlarmData, extra_data where scheduler is this instance of the scheduler start_time is chosen start time, end time is chosen end time entry is the entry that specified in the start_time, end_time in schedule_entries_tuning extra_data is the data passed in when creating the scheduler" group="General">

Tunable.name: spawn_weight
Tunable.description: Weight that object will have on the probability calculation of which object to spawn.

TunableVariant.name: spawner_option
TunableVariant.description: Type of spawners to create: Ground type - Spawned object will appear on the floor at a tunable radius from the spawner object. Slot type - Spawned object will appear on an available slot of a tunable slot type in the spawner object. Interaction type - Spawned objects will appear on the inventory when player makes a gather-harvest-scavenge interaction on them.

TunableVariant.name: force_initialization_spawn
TunableVariant.description: If checked, objects with this component will force a spawning of objects on initialization. This is mainly used for objects on the open street where we want to fake that some time has already passed. Additionally, if checked, objects will force the states on this list instead of the force_states list on the general spawner tuning, this way we can add some custom states only for the initialization spawn.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of states the created object will have when initialized.

TunableList.name: force_states
TunableList.description: List of states the created object will be pushed to.

TunableTuple.name: default_offset
TunableTuple.description: The default Vector3 offset from the location target's position.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableVariant.name: x_randomization_range
TunableVariant.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the x axis.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the x axis.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: z_randomization_range
TunableVariant.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the z axis.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the z axis.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: is_natural_ground
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the spawned object is on natural ground. If unchecked will test the object is not on natural ground

TunableVariant.name: is_outside
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if the spawned object is located outside. If unchecked will test the object is not outside

Tunable.name: min_radius
Tunable.description: Minimum distance away from the portal location to start looking for a good location.

TunableList.name: placement_scoring
TunableList.description: List of scoring functions used by FGL to determine best places to put the object. Will only apply to off-lot spawners.

TunableTuple.name: angular_scoring
TunableTuple.description: Score by position within a given angle.

Tunable.name: max_distance
Tunable.description: Max distance from optimal angle before the score becomes zero.

Tunable.name: optimal_angle
Tunable.description: Optimal angle from the tested location. Will score highest.

Tunable.name: width
Tunable.description: Absolute distance in meters from optimal angle (relative to location orientation) where location will attain the max score of 1.0 for this function.

TunableTuple.name: linear_distance_scoring
TunableTuple.description: Score by distance from a defined line.

Tunable.name: ignore_surface
Tunable.description: If unset, will ensure the location and the tested position share the same routing surface. Otherwise, scoring will not care if the two positions have different surfaces.

TunableTuple.name: initial_point
TunableTuple.description: Position relative to starting location used as first point in the line used for scoring.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

Tunable.name: max_distance
Tunable.description: Max distance from optimal before the score becomes zero.

Tunable.name: optimal_distance
Tunable.description: Optimal distance in meters from the tested location.

TunableTuple.name: secondary_point
TunableTuple.description: Secondary point used to create a line from initial point. This is relative to the starting location. Distance from this line will be measured.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableTuple.name: radial_distance_scoring
TunableTuple.description: Score by distance from starting point.

Tunable.name: ignore_surface
Tunable.description: If unset, will ensure the location and the tested position share the same routing surface. Otherwise, scoring will not care if the two positions have different surfaces.

Tunable.name: max_distance
Tunable.description: Max distance from optimal before the score becomes zero.

Tunable.name: optimal_distance
Tunable.description: Optimal distance in meters from the starting point.

Tunable.name: width
Tunable.description: Absolute distance from optimal width where location will attain the max score of 1.0 for this function.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Max radius at which the spawned object should appear

TunableList.name: restrictions
TunableList.description: List of orientation restrictions used by FGL when searching for a place to put the object. Will only apply to off-lot spawners.

TunableTuple.name: absolute_orientation
TunableTuple.description: A tunable orientation restriction.

TunableTuple.name: angle
TunableTuple.description: Tunable angle range for orientation of the target relative to the orientation of the original location.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: ideal_angle
Tunable.description: Ideal angle for orientation of the target.

TunableTuple.name: relative_facing_circle
TunableTuple.description: Orientation facing in a radius around a circle.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: Facing range to the circle.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Radius around the given point up to which will be tested.

TunableTuple.name: target_offset
TunableTuple.description: Offset relative to starting point as center of circle.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableTuple.name: relative_facing_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable relative facing orientation restriction.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: Facing range to the object.

TunableTuple.name: target_offset
TunableTuple.description: Offset relative to starting point to face.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableVariant.name: starting_location
TunableVariant.description: The location at which we want to start attempting to place the object we are creating.

TunableTuple.name: portal_location
TunableTuple.description: If selected the object will be spanwed near the location of the specified portal type and start or end location

TunableVariant.name: portal_direction
TunableVariant.description: Choose between the There and Back of the portal. This will not work properly if the portal is missing a Back and Back is specified here.

TunableVariant.name: portal_location
TunableVariant.description: Choose between the entry and exit location of the portal.

Tunable.name: portal_type
Tunable.description: A reference to the type of portal to use for the starting location.

TunableTuple.name: spawner_location
TunableTuple.description: If selected the object will be spawned near the location of the spawner object.

Tunable.name: consider_source_object_footprint
Tunable.description: If True, then the source object's footprints will be considered in the creation of FGL context. Example: If the source is invisible, then setting this to False would allow the spawned object to be located at its spawner's location. If the source is a visible object, then setting this to True would force the spawned object to be offset by any existing footprints on the source.

TunableVariant.name: force_initialization_spawn
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, objects with this component will force a spawning of objects on initialization. This is mainly used for objects on the open street where we want to fake that some time has already passed.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The number of objects to be created.

Tunable.name: slot_type
Tunable.description: Slot type where spawned objects should appear

TunableList.name: state_mapping
TunableList.description: Mapping of states from the spawner object into the possible states that the spawned object may have

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: List of possible children for a parent state

TunableTuple.description: Pair of weight and possible state that the spawned object may have

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: Weight that object will have on the probability calculation of which object to spawn.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Conditional tests to determine if spawning occurs.
